兼.definition: double; twice; simultaneous; holding two or more (official) posts at the same time

兼任.definition: to hold a concurrent post; part-time; (in academia) adjunct

兼併.definition: to annex; to take over; to acquire

兼容並包.definition: to include and monopolize many things; all-embracing

兼愛.definition: "universal love", principle advocated by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], stressing that people should care for everyone equally

兼營.definition: a second job; supplementary way of making a living

兼程.definition: to travel at double speed; to make all haste

兼而有之.definition: to have both (at the same time)

兼職.definition: to hold concurrent posts; concurrent job; moonlighting

兼聽則明，偏信則暗.pinyin: jian1 ting1 ze2 ming2 , pian1 xin4 ze2 an4
兼聽則明，偏信則暗.definition: listen to both sides and you will be enlightened; heed only one side and you will remain ignorant (idiom)

兼蓄.definition: to contain two things at a time; to mingle; to incorporate

兼課.definition: to teach classes in addition to other duties; to hold several teaching jobs

兼顧.definition: to handle two or more responsibilities at the same time; to balance (career and family, or work and studies etc)
